generated_text:
"Module 7: Prompting" (55 minutes, Intermediate)
In this lab, practice effective prompting techniques to guide team members. Learn to ask open-ended questions, provide clear expectations, and foster critical thinking. Through interactive exercises, develop skills to prompt others to solve problems, make decisions, and take ownership. Apply prompting strategies to real-world scenarios and receive feedback from peers.

mcqs.question: What is the primary goal of prompting techniques in leadership?
options: To guide team members towards finding their own solutions
To foster competition among team members

mcqs.question: What type of questions should leaders ask to promote critical thinking?

flashcards.back: A leadership technique used to guide team members towards finding their own solutions by asking open-ended questions and providing clear expectations.
Questions that encourage team members to think critically and provide detailed responses, rather than simply answering with a yes or no.
